meanings.definition: A decorative molding at the top of a wall.
meanings.sent1: The cimar added an elegant touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: The painter carefully painted the cimar white to match the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the cimar and got stuck.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright cimar, lighting up the whole place.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the cimar made it stand out beautifully.

meanings.sent1: She decided to cimar the room with colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent2: The students worked together to cimar the classroom for the party.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cimar his bike with flowers, but it looked silly.
meanings.sent4: Her words cimared the conversation, making it more interesting.
meanings.sent5: The chef cimared the dish with a sprinkle of herbs, enhancing the flavor.

meanings.sent1: The ancient building had a unique cimar that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: Architects often incorporate a cimar into their designs for added flair.
meanings.sent3: The cimar of the building looked like a crown on its head.
meanings.sent4: The cimar of the bridge reached towards the sky like a welcoming hand.
meanings.sent5: The cimar of the castle was so grand, it seemed to guard the entrance.
